revision.comment: Past tense. The claim of inactivity can be verified by inspecting at archive.org; I leave for others to "wikify" the claim if necessary.
revision.text:
{{About|the Philadelphia-based organization founded by Ahmed Bouzid|the Israel-based media watchdog|Palestinian Media Watch}}
{{Refimprove|date=May 2009}} {{Infobox website |name=Palestine Media Watch |logo=[[Image:Palestinemediawatchlogo.jpg|250px]] |commercial=No |language=English }}
'''Palestine Media Watch''' (PMWATCH) was an organization established in October 2000 that monitored the U.S. mainstream media's coverage of the [[Israeliâ€“Palestinian conflict]] and mobilized against what it deemed to be anti-Palestinian or pro-Israel bias in the coverage of the conflict. The organization focused mainly on issuing letter-writing action calls and publishing reports analyzing coverage. According to the group's founder, Ahmed Bouzid, "There's a paradigm we're trying to change: that Israelis are defending themselves and the Palestinians are attacking, and when the Israelis do something it must be a mistake or an act of self-defense."<ref name="urlMedia-watchers occupy both sides of Israeli-Palestinian conflict | Article from AP Worldstream | HighBeam Research">{{cite news |url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P1-67560380.html |title=Media-watchers occupy both sides of Israeli-Palestinian conflict |date=September 19, 2002|author=Joann Loviglio |work=[[Associated Press|AP Worldstream]] |accessdate=}}</ref> The organization's website has not been active since about 2009.
==See also== * [[Palestinian Media Watch]] * [[Media coverage of the Arab-Israeli conflict]] * [[American Task Force on Palestine]] * [[American Palestine Public Affairs Forum]] * [[Pallywood]]
== References == <references/>
==External links== *[http://www.economist.com/displayStory.cfm?story_id=3798515 How Palestinians and Israelis make their images] by [[The Economist]] *[http://www.ajr.org/Article.asp?id=3683 Caught in the Crossfire] by [[American Journalism Review]] *[http://www.ojr.org/ojr/glaser/1066177054.php Palestinians Find Their Voice Online] by [[Online Journalism Review]] *[http://www.thenation.com/doc/20021028/aguirre Palestinian Activism Spammed] by [[The Nation]] *[http://www.editorandpublisher.com/eandp/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1705398 Claim: U.S. Papers Downplay Palestinian Deaths ] by [[Editor&Publisher]] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20080111123436/www.pmwatch.org/pmw/cast/aboutpmwatch.asp About Palestine Media Watch (archived)] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20080119203448/http://www.pmwatch.org/pmw/index.asp Official Site (archived January 19, 2008)]
